pros: Teamwork, friendly staff, great bosses
cons: Too many patients assigned per nurse/nurse extern.

job_title: Social Worker (MSW) in Bayonet Point, FL
pros: The company really cares about their employees. Compensation is competitive. Good food in the cafeteria! Which can be deducted from your pay.
cons: Stressful atmosphere. Which is to be expected. When employees have personal setbacks and need to take a leave, don't expect to be welcomed back.

pros: not much, you exchange labor for cash
cons: Horrible management, from Top-down. No people skills, strictly for the dollar, This company was great under Columbia

job_title: Student Nurse Extern in Bayonet Point, FL
pros: Big hospital, fast paced, room to pick up shifts
cons: Low staff and high number of travelers

pros: Team members and organization are good
cons: Poor management and lack of consistent raises

review_title: run as fast as you can
job_title: Maintenance Tech III in Bayonet Point, FL
pros: nothing at all, this is the worst company i have ever worked for,
cons: Sorry I spent 13 years of my life working for this company. The CEO back than was Shane George, A.K.A. Napoleon, and his sidekick Joe R. Not even worth the mention. I was Terminated after I contacted ethics and compliance about an ethics complaint. Terminated within 48 hrs

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Hudson, FL
pros: Opportunity for learning IV, Pyxis, generic/ name brands. Great stepping stone for those who want to learn chemo meds, or are going in to nursing
cons:
No growth
Unorganised
Low pay
Be ready to work all shifts no matter what you’re hired for.

pros: Wonderful Doctors. Wonderful Co-workers. wonderful ancillary staff. Departments are excepting to endoscopy on their floor.
cons: not sure what to write here

pros: staff, teamwork, experience, teaching, collaboration
cons: management, charge nurse, charting, doctors, rations

review_title: Great Place to Work!  Great Teamwork, Lots of longevity among employees
pros: Leadership from Officers to Directors and Management are approachable, connected and interested.  Despite what the media prints about a for profit hospital, this hospital is all about the patients and giving great care.  Great pride and celebration every time another award is won.  Staffed by hard working employees, and engaged management  the culture is one that is open to new ideas and works hard to make an enjoyable work environment because happy employees do a better job and it shows!  Feels like family, that is why so many people have worked here for so long.
cons: Believe it or not this is also a plus.  Part of a larger hospital system, sometimes change works slowly if it needs approval on a larger (corporate) scale.  The plus is that being part of a large corporation means good pay, good benefits and the newest technology.  This helps  in job satisfaction and great patient care.

pros: The only pro I can think of in my over a year of working there as an RN was my co-workers. I made amazing relationships there, and they were the only reason I didn’t leave this job after a few months.
cons: Hey Understaffed, and if we had enough staff, the night supervisor would send nurses home or float them. We had unsafe nurse to patio ratios; on a good night I had 6 patients, but most nights were 7 patients. The director on my floor was very clique-ey. The director would pick favorites, and if you weren’t in that group, you would be written up for things that didn’t warrant such an action. The turn over rate is extremely high, and when they told me that during my interview back in 2016, I should have run. But what new nurse is going to turn down their first hospital job?

review_title: Great company- good pay- good benefits. Each department has it's own ups & downs!
job_title: Med Tech in Bayonet Point, FL
pros: Benefits. Will not fire for no reason. Great company.  Pay is good- they frequently do market adjustments. Shift differentials for certain professions. Trauma center.
cons: Allows people to work up to 160 hours in an 80 hour pay period- unsafe work practice. Bad cafeteria. If you work night shift (but not an RN) you will have no food available! Open till 7 when nursing comes in- not helpful if you work 8 hour shift starting at 11p. If you work nights- you are forgotten- no free meals- no special celebrations. Totally overlooked.

pros: Started working as a nurse intern while I went to school for my RN. Was offered a full-time RN position right out of school. Transferred to my preferred department within 7 months. Depending on the department, managers are very receptive to employee feedback. Great benefits--medical, dental, vision, short term/long term disability, life insurance.
cons: Unsafe staffing ratios. Assignments based on numbers, not acuity. On site daycare needs some facility improvement--very outdated. Administration highly focused on "patient experience" rather than employee satisfaction.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Hudson, FL
pros:
Many of the leadership have good intentions and care about their staff, but are limited by policies in their ability to provide what is needed.

The medical staff are responsive and knowledgeable in most cases, even though it is a teaching hospital and residents are the main gatekeepers.

Pay and benefits are adequate, but not enough to compensate for the overall burden.

There are a lot of people working there who care. If you have the strength to help them improve, there is still hope.
cons:
HCA- This is a basically good hospital and staff under the thumb of a mammoth hospital system that cares more about its bottom line than the well-being of its employees and, subsequently, its clients.

MEDITECH- the most antiquated and inadequate EMR ever created, much less still in use. Only a cheapskate bureaucracy would still be willing to put their staff and patients at risk by continuing to utilize it. 

A moderately higher than average population of indigents and substance abusers, although that is becoming endemic to any community.

job_title: Med-Surg Telemetry Registered Nurse in Hudson, FL
pros: Excellent service for the community and excellent nursing care.  Happy to be apart of that team caring for patients.  Learned a lot as a new nurse.
cons: Staff can be unfriendly.  Staffing issues were occurring often.  Not many opportunities for growth on unit I worked on.  Unhappy with scheduling and management.

review_title: It was a decent place to work. Had some good and bad points to working there
pros: Director on my floor was really great.  The job was always interesting and you never knew what was going to happen. There was good team work
cons: Most nights there was not enough staff. They were short CNAs most nights. Pay needs to be increased to stay competitive with other hospitals.

pros: Regional Medical Center Bayonet Point offers good benefits. The pay is average. The facility is a level 2 trauma center, primary heart and stroke center, and performs open heart and neuro surgery. This offers good experience for medical professionals.
cons: The administration is continually shifting. There is a high turn over rate among employees. Profit and image are valued more than proper staffing and employee well-being.

pros: Met some great people, benefits were ok, they did bbq's for employees once a year, easy to find if you had a problem with something
cons: Work load was way to much, nurses helping out is unheard of. Ever since I left I heard they changed management and it's gotten worse

pros: If you're full time you can choose to receive health benefits. But, it comes at a hefty price out of your paycheck.
cons: Poor raises. No breaks. Understaffed. High turn over of employees quitting due to the way they are spoken to and are being over worked without regard to the toll it takes on their bodied. If you don't have a degree of some sort in this hospital your pay is low and comstamtly driven and told to do more. When they are working as hard as they can and they're given no breaks. It's a hospital. Not a  court ordered labor prison camp.

review_title: HORRIBLE RUN FAST Management is incompetent
pros: None. If you're not in the "click" or kiss butt.
cons:
Directors and nurse leaders get promoted on their years not people skills. Most are incompetent in their skills. I had RN's asking me how to do tasks that were basic skills. ( turning, changing patients) Younger nursing students are treated like royalty while the experienced are degraded,  lied to and about, and basically pushed out to make room for the newbies. 
I was forced to file with EEOC after a discrimination issue.

pros: Co-workers co- workers co- workers
cons: Low pay, no raise or very minimum. Work exceeds people with no budget but the management gets their thousands of dollars bonuses.

review_title: Friendly and helpful staff, fair quality equipment, I'll staffed
pros: Staff was always willing to help and generally friendly. There is room for growth within the company and the potential for picking up extra shifts,
cons: Often times I'll staffed. Some equipment could have been better maintained or improved. Night shift gets little recognition, often forgot about during employee appreciation or holidays.

review_title: enjoyed the job but dislike their policy
job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Hudson, FL
pros: no options for personal growth in the job I worked,,most technicians were there longer than me and did not give me a chance to advance,i was able to work a lot of overtime
cons: no room for growth and not appreciated

review_title: For profit not for employee or patient
pros: Great co workers, good temporary or beginning job. Good Education Department.
cons: Medical Equipment does not work in rooms, high nurse-patient ratio.  Little room for advancement. Poor Med-Surgical leadership team.

job_title: Plant Operator in Bayonet Point, FL
pros: Nothing all the pros went to work for baycare and other Hospitals who treat their employees with respect and dignity. NOT LIKE A SLAVE AND A NUMBER.
cons: It's a con from the CEO to the CFO to the COO down to the department managers specially plant operations and evs.

review_title: So far so good. Teamwork, fair, involved management. Realistic work environment.
pros: Supportive staff, competent and involved management.
cons: High stress, fast paced, long hours

job_title: Registered Nurse, ICU in Spring Hill, FL
pros: Great opportunity to learn from experienced nurses.
cons: New employees be prepared to work every holiday.

pros: Flexible competitive pay many areas to move to
cons: Sometimes staffing is tight compared to pt ratios

job_title: CNA- Certified Nursing Assistant in New Port Richey, FL
pros: HCA is a great corporation to work for!
cons: 12 hour shifts can be long!

pros: There is none.horrible place to work for. You get treated like garbage, no raises, mgr finds any reason to write you up. Old equipment, bad attitudes.
cons: Everything is a con about this place. I could go on forever about this establishment.
